title: Have any of these faces got digital versions yet?
content:
Found a few faces I quite liked in an old sample book and fancied bringing a couple into the digital age. had a look around but couldn't find digital versions of any, but wanted a few more eyes to check them over and ensure I don't duplicate work...

Faces are here: [http://www.stone-soup.co.uk/uploads/fonts1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140719115716/http:/www.stone-soup.co.uk/uploads/fonts1.jpg "http://www.stone-soup.co.uk/uploads/fonts1.jpg")

Obviously Hidalgo is very much a Clarendon style slab, but there's a couple of differences (notably the 2 and 7 which I've failed to put on the sample), and Crusader seems to mostly be Swash/decorative caps -- I'm mostly interested in Philite, as I've fallen in love with it and want to get stuck in.

Anyone spot any that I shouldn't bother with?
author: Jim Stafford

comments.content: Thanks, I mustn't have looked hard enough!

If you like Philite, you might like the [caps on MeMimas Alternate](http://web.archive.org/web/20140719115716/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/type_o_tones/memimas_alternate/?sample_text=ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOP&sample_size=56).

Also check out Berliner Grotesk - less personality but a similar style to Philite.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/berliner-grotesk-bq/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140719115716/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/berliner-grotesk-bq/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/berliner-grotesk-bq/")
Ah, a new one on me, but I see the similarities.

Oh, fine... Berliner Grotesk as a digital font.  
I did not know that.
